meanings.definition: Characterized by or subject to storms.
meanings.sent1: The sky turned dark and stormy, warning us of the approaching rain.
meanings.sent2: The sailors decided to stay ashore due to the stormy weather conditions.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was canceled because of the stormy forecast, leaving everyone disappointed.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like a stormy sea, constantly changing and unpredictable.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind and crashing waves created a truly stormy atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Marked by or subject to turmoil or upheaval.
meanings.sent1: Their relationship had been stormy for months, filled with arguments and misunderstandings.
meanings.sent2: The company faced a stormy period of financial difficulties before finally recovering.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was always stormy when the students disagreed on a topic.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like a stormy sea, turbulent and chaotic.
meanings.sent5: The political debate turned into a stormy exchange of opposing views.
